Reader

Reader#

class reader.Reader[source]#

Reader class used to extract and retrieve specific information for a given MTO report.

convert_table_to_df(page)[source]#

Convert transaction table from PDF page to structured DataFrame.

Processes the main transaction table located between: 1. “TAX ON STOCK-EXCHANGE TRANSACTIONS” header 2. “TOTAL TAX BASIS” summary section

Returns:

Structured transaction data with columns:

  • ASSET_NAME: Security name (cleaned from multi-line formatting)

  • DATE: Transaction date in DD/MM/YYYY format

  • TRANSACTION: Transaction type (BUY/SELL)

  • TRADED_PRICE_IN_EUR: Unit price in euros

  • QUANTITY: Number of units traded

  • TAX_BASIS_IN_EUR: Taxable amount in euros

  • TAX_AMOUNT_IN_EUR: Calculated tax in euros

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Note

Requires pandas installation. All numeric columns are converted to float. Handles multi-line asset names and cleans formatting artifacts.

extract_banking_infos(page)[source]#

Extract structured banking information from a PDF page.

Parses the following details from raw text: - Account holder name - IBAN number - BIC/SWIFT code - Payment reference code

Parameters:

page (Page) – PyMuPDF Page object containing banking details

Returns:

Dictionary with extracted banking information. Typical keys:

  • Name: Account holder name

  • IBAN: International Bank Account Number

  • BIC: Bank Identifier Code

  • Payment Reference: Structured payment reference

Values are stripped of surrounding whitespace.

Return type:

dict[str, str]

extract_full_content(doc, safe_to_yaml=None)[source]#

Extract structured content from a document and optionally saves to a YAML file.

Args: doc: Input document object to process safe_to_yaml: Optional path to save extracted data as YAML.

Filename will include current year-month if used.

Returns:

  • Page 0: user_infos, tax_authority_infos

  • Other pages: purpose, summary, df (tabular data as records)

Return type:

Nested dictionary with keys formatted as ‘page_{n}’ containing

extract_personal_information(page)[source]#

Extract structured personal information from a PDF page’s raw text.

Uses regular expressions to identify and extract key personal details including: - Full name - Postal address - Securities account number - Document date

Parameters:

page (Page) – PyMuPDF Page object containing the personal information section

Returns:

Dictionary with extracted information. Explanation:

  • full_name: Combined first and last name

  • address: Street address with postal code

  • securities_account: Account number

  • date: Document date in DD.MM.YYYY format

Missing fields will have None values.

Return type:

dict[str, str | None]

Note

Matching is case-sensitive and depends on specific document formatting

extract_purpose_and_rate(page)[source]#

Extract tax purpose and rate from document header.

Identifies the transaction purpose and applicable tax rate from the main header section containing “TAX ON STOCK-EXCHANGE TRANSACTIONS”.

Parameters:

page (Page) – PyMuPDF Page object containing tax header

Returns:

(purpose_description, tax_rate_percentage) if found Example: (“SECURITIES”, “0.12%”)

Return type:

tuple[str, str]|None

Note

Returns None if the pattern isn’t found in the header text

extract_summary_infos(page)[source]#

Extract financial summary from the bottom of a transaction table.

Captures key totals including: - Total tax basis - Total tax amount - Other summary financial metrics

Parameters:

page (Page) – PyMuPDF Page object containing summary section

Returns:

Key-value pairs of summary metrics. Typical keys:

  • ”TOTAL TAX BASIS”: Sum of all taxable amounts

  • ”TOTAL TAX AMOUNT”: Total tax liability

Values converted to floating-point numbers

Return type:

dict[str, float]

get_raw_text_banking_infos(page)[source]#

Extract raw text from the banking information section of a PDF page.

Identifies the section starting at “Where and how does the TST have to be paid?” and captures all text from that point to the bottom of the page.

Parameters:

page (Page) – PyMuPDF Page object containing banking details

Returns:

Raw text containing bank account information and payment references

Return type:

str

get_raw_text_personal_infos(page)[source]#

Extract raw text from the personal information section of a PDF page.

Identifies the relevant section by locating the “BERLIN” header at the top and “TAX ON STOCK-EXCHANGE TRANSACTIONS (TST) REPORT” at the bottom, then extracts all text between these two markers.

Parameters:

  • page (Page) – A PyMuPDF Page object representing the first PDF page of

  • process. (the monthly tax report to)

Returns:

Extracted text from the identified personal information section. Returns empty string if no text found in the target region.

Return type:

str

Note

The coordinates system in PyMuPDF has its origin (0,0) at the top-left corner of the page, with y-values increasing downward.

save_data_to_yaml(data)[source]#

Save the extracted data into a YAML status file.

Parameters:

data (_type_) – Data to keep.

Return type:

None
